DataElement.preferredName: Internal Mammary Lymph Node Radiation Therapy Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Administered Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether radiation therapy was administered to the lymph nodes located in the armpit following neodajuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Internal Mammary Lymph Node Radiation Therapy Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of radiation therapy to the lymph nodes located under the ribcage near the sternum following neodajuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Internal Mammary Lymph Node Radiation Therapy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
